intro: Cracca venosa, commonly known as the veined cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a distinctive veined leaf structure, which gives it its scientific name. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges and meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
